column4: how would I display the keyboard shortcut for the Application Menu on a desktop (from the command line)?
trying now using gconftool-2 - but can't seem to find the entry
user changed their shortcut, trying to figure out what it is
do you have the desktop in front of you?
you could run ubuntu-tweak via forwarded X and set stuff
ubuntu configures X forwarding enabled by default, very handy
Unity is a shell for Gnome, so they are booting in to Gnome
you can run:  gnome-control-center      after you connect with an X forward enabled session and change the setting
- not sure how to run xforward session.. and I am attached via vpn
ssh -X username@server     instead of:  ssh username@server
if you connect in that manner, you can run GUI apps and they will run on the server side but show on the client (much like Citrix does). Its slow over WWW but works
its the same as being on the local system too so you will be manipulating the settings of the user you run the command with
- andâ€¦ can this be done from a mac? (i'm running 10.8.1 on this machine)
I'd imagine so, Does Mac have an X server. I've not used it much. I can't stand MacOS
